00022 #ifndef MAMA_CONNECTION_CPP_H__
00023 #define MAMA_CONNECTION_CPP_H__
00024 
00025 #include "mama/mamacpp.h"
00026 #include "mama/MamaTransport.h"
00027 #include "mama/conflation/connection.h"
00028 
00029 namespace Wombat
00030 {
00031 
00032 class MAMACPPExpDLL MamaConnection
00033 {
00034 public:
00035     MamaConnection (MamaTransport* tport, mamaConnection cnxn) 
00036         : mConnnection (cnxn)
00037         , mTransport   (tport) {}
00038 
00039     virtual ~MamaConnection (void);
00040     
00041     /* Convenience method to get the transport to which this connection belongs.     */
00042     MamaTransport* getTransport (void) const;
00043 
00044     /* Return the remote IP address.
00045      */
00046     const char* getIpAddress (void) const;
00047 
00048     /* return the remote port. Note for outbound connections this will be the
00049      * "ephemeral" port assigned by connect() while the IP address will be the 
00050      * local address. For inbound connection it will be the "ephemeral" port 
00051      * on the remote client and the IP address of the remote client.
00052      *
00053      * The combination of IP address and port uniquely identifies the 
00054      * connection/client.
00055      */
00056     uint16_t getPort (void) const;
00057 
00058     /* Return the username related to this event. */
00059     const char* getUserName (void) const;
00060 
00061     /* Return the application name related to this event. */
00062     const char* getAppName (void) const;
00063 
00064     /* Return the current queue size which triggered the event. */
00065     uint32_t getQueueSize (void) const;
00066 
00067     /* Return the maximum queue size. */
00068     uint32_t getMaxQueueSize (void) const;
00069 
00070     /* Return the number of messages sent on the connection. */
00071     uint32_t getMsgCount (void) const;
00072 
00073     /* Return the number of bytes sent on the connection. */
00074     uint32_t getBytesSent (void) const;
00075 
00076     /* Return the string version of the connection. */
00077     const char* toString (void) const;
00078 
00079     /* Return true if this connection is intercepted. */
00080     bool isIntercepted (void) const;
00081 
00082     // Access to C types for implementation of related classes.
00083     mamaConnection        getCValue    ();
00084     const mamaConnection  getCValue    () const;
00085 private:
00086     mamaConnection          mConnnection; 
00087     MamaTransport*          mTransport;
00088 
00089     MamaConnection (void) {}
00090     MamaConnection (const MamaConnection&) {}
00091 
00092 };
00093 
00094 }
00095 #endif
